Description: Fragment of an East Greek pottery lid; cream slip on top, with decoration in two friezes separated by bands with added red and white lines: lotus flowers and buds in thin reddish brown, and a series of double spirals surrounded by dots; only part of central design preserved; frieze of bars on outside of rim. Underside is reserved.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 220, no. 72)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 108, pl. XXXIV, no. 319.7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.397)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5750 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
